title: Newtons second law-direction of unbalanced force

content.question: A person of mass <math alttext="90 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>90</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math> stands on a scale in an elevator. The scale reads <math alttext="1100 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1100</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>. Which of the following is a correct claim about the direction of the elevatorâ€™s motion?

choices.label: The elevator must be moving upward.
The elevator could possibly be moving upward and slowing down.
The elevator must be moving downward.
The elevator could possibly be moving downward and slowing down.

content.answer: The elevator could possibly be moving downward and slowing down.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
